question: Should the system support multiple children sharing the same device with separate profiles?
context: How does the system handle multiple children using the same device? [NEEDS CLARIFICATION: Should the game support multiple child profiles with individual progress tracking?]
answer_options:
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| A | Yes - Support 3-5 individual child profiles with separate progress tracking | Each child gets personalized experience, increases data storage needs, requires profile selection UI at startup |
| B | No - Single profile only, all children share the same progress | Simpler implementation, no profile management needed, but siblings may conflict over progress |
| C | Optional - Single profile by default, with ability to add profiles later | MVP launches faster with single profile, can add multi-profile as enhancement |

question: How should parents access the parental control settings to prevent children from changing them?
context: FR-008: System MUST include parental controls accessible via [NEEDS CLARIFICATION: Should this be password-protected, time-delayed button, or math problem verification?]
answer_options:
| Option | Answer | Implications |
|--------|--------|--------------|
| A | Simple math problem (e.g., "What is 5 + 3?") | Child-proof for 4-year-olds, no password to remember, quick access for parents |
| B | 5-second hold button | Very simple, no typing needed, but determined children might discover it |
| C | 4-digit PIN code | Most secure, but parents must remember PIN, requires number input interface |
